alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Blowing Dust Advisory issued April 13 at 7:21PM CDT until April 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, isolated wind gusts to 65 mph with decaying showers. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust. * WHERE...Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult especially for high profile vehicles. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Stay alert when driving for rapidly changing conditions.
